questions.question: The period from which mainly stone tools are found is called
questions.answer: Stone Age

questions.question: Old Stone Age is also known as
questions.answer: Palaeolithic Age

questions.question: Which technique was used to make early stone tools?
questions.answer: Percussion

questions.question: Which tool had a sharp edge on one side only?
questions.answer: Chopper

questions.question: Who made the earliest stone tools?
questions.answer: Homo habilis

questions.question: Which tool shows mental visualization?
questions.answer: Hand-axe

questions.question: Which animal part was used as a hammer?
questions.answer: Antler

questions.question: Which age comes between Old and New Stone Age?
questions.answer: Mesolithic Age

questions.question: Which age means 'New Stone Age'?
questions.answer: Neolithic

questions.question: Who made long and narrow stone blades?
questions.answer: Homo sapiens

questions.question: Which material was also used by Homo sapiens to make tools?
questions.answer: Ivory

questions.question: Which tools helped scraping meat?
questions.answer: Scrapers

questions.question: Which technique involves striking stones?
questions.answer: Percussion

questions.question: Which factor decides the choice of tool?
questions.answer: Task requirement

questions.question: Which animal is known to use stones to crack nuts?
questions.answer: Chimpanzee

questions.question: The period from which mainly stone tools are found is called
questions.answer: Stone Age

questions.question: Old Stone Age is also known as
questions.answer: Palaeolithic Age

questions.question: Which technique was used to make early stone tools?
questions.answer: Percussion

questions.question: Which tool had a sharp edge on one side only?
questions.answer: Chopper

questions.question: Who made the earliest stone tools?
questions.answer: Homo habilis

questions.question: What is Stone Age?
questions.answer: Stone Age is the period when humans mainly used stone tools.

questions.question: Why is it called Stone Age?
questions.answer: Because stone tools are mainly found from this period.

questions.question: What is percussion technique?
questions.answer: It is the method of striking stones to make tools.

questions.question: Who made the earliest stone tools?
questions.answer: Homo habilis made the earliest stone tools.

questions.question: What is a chopper?
questions.answer: A chopper is a crude stone tool with one sharp edge.

questions.question: What were choppers used for?
questions.answer: They were used for breaking nuts and bones.

questions.question: Who made hand-axes?
questions.answer: Homo erectus made hand-axes.

questions.question: Why are hand-axes important?
questions.answer: They show mental planning and skill.

questions.question: What is Mesolithic Age?
questions.answer: It is the Middle Stone Age.

questions.question: What is Neolithic Age?
questions.answer: It is the New Stone Age.

questions.question: Who made blades of stone?
questions.answer: Homo sapiens made long stone blades.

questions.question: Name any two stone tools.
questions.answer: Chopper and scraper are stone tools.

questions.question: Why are bone tools rarely found?
questions.answer: Because bones decompose easily.

questions.question: Which animals were hunted using stone tools?
questions.answer: Deer and bison were hunted.

questions.question: Why were tools important for humans?
questions.answer: They helped humans survive and get food.

questions.question: What materials besides stone were used?
questions.answer: Bone and antlers were also used.

questions.question: What factors affect tool choice?
questions.answer: Availability, efficiency and skill.

questions.question: What is a scraper?
questions.answer: A scraper is a tool used to scrape meat or hide.

questions.question: Why did Homo sapiens stay longer in one place?
questions.answer: Because of better tools and food sources.

questions.question: What does Palaeo mean?
questions.answer: Palaeo means old.
